gauzy: a gauzy surface appears soft and vague to the naked eye.

meshed: a meshed texture is like a tangled thread of interconnected threads woven together in a complex pattern that resembles a woven fabric with holes and gaps.
meshed material is usually composed of loosely connected fibers or threads of different textures and colors combined in a way that creates a visually interesting pattern.
cracked: cracked material appears as shattered fragments of a whole object with visible fissures and cracks.
a cracked surface is typically rough and uneven, showing visible cracks or fissures.
stratified: a stratified surface is typically formed through layered formation of sediment often with visible different colored layers indicating different depths or ages of sediment deposited.
a stratified texture is a layered or stacked pattern of different materials and materials with varying textures and colors.
scaly: scaly material is typically rough and texture to human skin or rough to animal hides that often develops distinctive patterns or mottling in response to environmental stimuli.
a scaly surface has a rough texture with many small raised bumps and ridges that give it a thick, protective layer of tough, leathery skin.
swirly: a swirly surface is often circular or spiral in shape and appears to be moving when viewed from different angles.
a swirly surface is characterized by its circular motion with no discernible boundaries or edges around it.
perforated: perforated material is often circular or rectangular holes.
a perforated texture is often described as having small holes or gaps that make it look rough and uneven in texture and often has a rougher appearance than smooth textures.
pleated: a pleated surface is a folded layer of fabric with parallel folds on one side.

flecked: a flecked surface is characterized by small dots or patches of color scattered throughout the larger area
flecked material appears as irregular patches of color varying in intensity on a surface.
fibrous: a fibrous surface appears as a layered texture with individual fibers embedded in a dense network.
a fibrous surface is often rough and porous.
polka-dotted: a polka dotted texture is a small speck or dot of color on a surface with a grid of solid lines, often yellow or white.
a polka-dot texture has small dots of different colors evenly spaced across a solid surface.
chequered: a chequered surface is typically a multicolored pattern of two distinct colors side by side.
chequered material has a distinctive appearance.
blotchy: a blotchy texture appears as unevenly distributed patches of color on the skin often with dark or light tones blending together inconsistently naturally.
a blotchy texture is often described as having patches of color that do not blend smoothly together.
stained: a stained texture typically appears as a dull or opaque discoloration on the surface of a material that has been heavily soiled or contaminated.
stained material usually appears brown or reddish in color due to various chemicals or substances used in its production period.
crystalline: a crystalline texture is often characterized by its smooth, reflective, and transparent appearance.
a crystalline texture is often characterized by being smooth and unbroken.
porous: porous material has a texture that is often irregular and rough to the touch.
a porous texture is similar to that of sand or earth.
banded: a banded texture appears as repeating pattern of alternating bands of color on a surface.
a banded texture is often seen on fabrics like striped or polka dot patterns that feature a repeating design on a solid background.
lacelike: lacelike material appears to have a smooth and shiny surface with a slight sheen.
a lacelike surface appears as a textured layer of woven fibers often visible on the outside of fabric or leather products like jackets or bags.
sprinkled: sprinkled material has tiny particles dispersed throughout.
a sprinkled surface is a flat or smooth area covered with tiny droplets of water that are dispersed throughout the surface in a random and uneven manner.
bubbly: a bubbly surface is a layer of tiny air bubbles that form on its surface when it is poured or mixed with air bubbles are trapped in it.
a light and airy bumpy texture often appears when something is fresh and moist.
lined: a lined surface is a flat, rectangular piece of material with evenly spaced horizontal and vertical lines.
a lined surface typically has a smooth, flat, and even top layer made of a single material such as paper or a thin film of plastic or other substances.
veined: a veined surface appears with streaks of color within the background.

a veined surface has a pattern of tiny lines or streaks on its surface that result from microscopic variations in the material's texture or structure that appear when light hits it and the different areas reflect slightly differently.
bumpy: a bumpy texture is rough and uneven in appearance.
a bumpy surface appears as a series of small protrusions or irregularities that cause a disturbance when pressed against the surface.
paisley: paisley patterns are typically characterized by a symmetrical design featuring repeating motifs of flowers and leaves in a specific arrangement.
paisley patterns typically consist of a central motif repeated in various ways around a body of solid color.
potholed: potholed material appears as cracked and rough terrain with jagged edges often caused by exposure to heavy rain or extreme weather conditions.
potholed material appears as a mix of different materials such as rock, stone, and broken concrete or asphalt that has been fractured and roughened to create a damaged or uneven surface.

a frilly surface usually has delicate patterns and soft textures.
spiralled: spiralled material is often curved and twisted into intricate patterns, often exhibiting a smooth and wavy texture.
spiralled material appears as a series of twisted rods made from fibre like yarn or thread.
knitted: knitted material appears as soft tangled threads.

grooved: a grooved texture is often seen on things like rough cut stone or wood grain patterns that are visually defined by layers of material being cut at an angle or irregularly

dotted: a dotted texture is a pattern of lines with tiny dots on it.
a dotted surface is a thin layer of raised dots on the surface of a fabric or other material
interlaced: a thin layer of water can form between a surface and a object, creating an interlaced surface that has a distinct texture.
interlaced material is a weave or pattern where threads or yarns are woven in an overlapping manner so that the resulting fabric has a unique texture and visual interest.
crosshatched: a crosshatched surface has a pattern of closely spaced parallel lines.
a crosshatched surface has lines or dots in a pattern that intersect with each other.
wrinkled: a wrinkled texture typically has a soft and slightly elastic appearance.
a wrinkled texture is characterized by a creased or marred surface often resulting from repeated use or handling.
smeared: smeared material appears as a thin and blurry discoloration on surfaces when it is applied in excess.

striped: a striped surface is a pattern of horizontal stripes of different colors arranged in a repeating sequence.

braided: braid is a type of twisted yarn or thread that comes in many different colors and textures to add an element of interest to various crafts and textiles.
a braided texture appears as a series of twisted strands woven together in a pattern.
freckled: a freckled surface often appears as small scattered spots or blotches that resemble tiny dots on a otherwise even skin tone often resulting in a warm or uneven texture.
a freckled texture is often characterized by small, scattered, and uneven patterns of darker and lighter shades of skin tone.
cobwebbed: a cobwebbed texture is fragile and delicate with long threads or strands that resemble the soft, powdery residue of a spider's web.
cobwebs are fragile and delicate threads of silk or spider silk that cling to surfaces often found in damp or humid environments.
honeycombed: honeycombed concrete is characterized by a network of small, irregular cells.
honeycombed material is made of small holes and spaces between particles that resemble a web-like structure.
woven: a woven surface typically has a fabric texture created by threads of different colors and materials woven together in a specific pattern.

marbled: a marbled surface is characterized by a mixture of different colors or shades of the same color creating a pattern of varying degrees of intensity or darkness and lightness.
a marbled texture is a pattern with speckled or flecked appearance created by mixing different colors or materials.
studded: a studded texture is rough and often has sharp points.
a studded surface has raised, sharp, and pointed projections of metal or stone that are spaced at regular intervals and can be felt underfoot.
